isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 530 Engine Diagnostic Manual for 4000 Series Trucks (2001) - MECHANICAL DIAGNOSTICS DT 466 and DT 530 - PERFORMANCE DIAGNOSTICS - Diagnostic Trouble Code Access

note.para: Accessing Diagnostic Trouble Codes using the Cruise Control buttons is primarily used as a backup method when an EST is not available.

entry.para: See figure C on back of form.
• Set Parking Brake, turn ignition switch ON.
• Depress CRUISE ON and RESUME/ACCEL buttons simultaneously.

svcsubproc.title: Purpose
svcsubproc.para: To read DTC's detected by the Electronic Control Module (ECM), if the Electronic Service Tool (EST) is not available, or if the EST does not receive Self Test Input data.

The Cruise Control buttons on the steering wheel act as an interface between the Operator and the ECM. The resulting display of the flashing amber ENGINE lamp indicates the ECM is performing a series of electronic tests.

svcsubproc.title: Test Procedure
svcsubproc.para: To display Diagnostic Trouble Codes, set the parking brake and turn the ignition key to the ON position. Press and release the CRUISE ON button and the RESUME/ACCEL button simultaneously . Do not start the engine.
When the test is complete, the ECM will flash the red ENGINElamp and the amber ENGINE lamp to signal the Diagnostic Trouble Codes.

To read the Diagnostic Trouble Code count each time the amber ENGINElamp flashes follow the sequence below. This sequence occurs each time the Cruise Control buttons are depressed to access the Diagnostic Trouble Codes.

figure.caption: Cruise Control Buttons on Steering Wheel

step1.para: The red ENGINE lamp will flash once to indicate the beginning of ACTIVEDTC's.
The amber ENGINE lamp will flash repeatedly signaling the active DTC's.

note.para: All DTC's are three digits. Code 111 indicates no Diagnostic Trouble Codes have been detected.

step1.para: Count the flashes in sequence. After each digit of the code a short pause will occur. Three flashes and a pause would indicate number 3. Two flashes, a pause, three flashes, a pause, and two flashes and a pause would indicate Diagnostic Trouble Code 232. If there is more than one DTC, the red ENGINE lamp will flash once indicating the beginning of another active DTC.

svcsubproc.para: After all active DTC's have flashed, the red ENGINE lamp will flash twice to indicate the start of INACTIVE DTC's. Count the flashes from the amber ENGINE lamp. If there is more than one inactive code, the red ENGINE lamp will flash once between each DTC.
After all DTC's have been sent, the red ENGINE lamp will flash three times indicating END OF MESSAGE.
To repeat DTC transmission, press and release the CRUISE ON and RESUME/ACCEL buttons once. The ECM will once again send the stored DTC's. If DTC's are set, see Engine Diagnostic Trouble Codes .

item.para: Set park brake (required for correct ESC signal and to clear codes).
Turn key switch to the IGN/ON position.
Depress and hold the CRUISE ON and RESUME/ACCEL buttons simultaneously.
Continue holding the Cruise Control buttons. Depress and release the accelerator pedal three (3) times within a six (6) second interval.
If DTC's are set, see DTC column on Engine Diagnostic Trouble Codes .
